revised_title: The Comparative Efficiency of Positively and Negatively Charged Ions as Condensation Nuclei
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Atmospheric Science
tldr: The author's experiments demonstrate that negatively charged ions are more efficient as condensation nuclei than positively charged ions, which could explain the preponderance of negatively electrified rain. This research contributes to understanding the relationship between atmospheric electricity and precipitation.
